lexUnit.name: chance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a possibility of something happening

sentence.text: For another , there was little or no chance that the National government , working with a very large Conservative majority , would be in danger of political defeat even on the matter of ` appeasement " .
Nevertheless , there is just as much of a chance that you will win through your difficulties as there is of reaching the point of throwing in the towel .
On the other hand , there is a fair chance that he might find a magic potion which will restore him to full strength and heal his wounds .
There was still the faintest of chances that Mickey Annan might still be among the living .
There was also the chance that I would recover from the madness . "
Maybe there 's a chance that he 's better than he 's pretending . "
So there is little chance of our newsreaders breaking off , US-style , from a headline story to extol the virtues of a brand of paint , or even a national newspaper .
The latest shift has prompted a rethink , not only because rates have risen but because chances of them falling significantly have receded probably until the spring .
No glass partition , much less chance of Creed noticing anything unusual .
THERE is a 12 per cent chance of a major earthquake hitting southern California next year , scientists predicted yesterday .
But he insisted : ` There 's no chance of me changing my mind .
People who knew us well before we married did n't think there was a chance of it working .
The chances of banks running out of cash are practically nil .
` What you mean is : there 's no chance of my being kept on after the three years are up . "
In a bound book there is less chance of anything being lost -- especially if you write in ink so that there can be no later alterations .

For an installation to be secure against fire , flood and other disasters it is essential for the primary and secondary items to be stored in different locations so that the chances of their simultaneous destruction are minimised .

JOHN Major is an even money chance to lead the Conservatives into the next General Election with bookmakers William Hill who are offering odds of 8-11 that he will be out of office by then .
There 'll be no chance for me getting a job .

To be in with a chance of winning you 'll have to answer the following three questions ( the categories are popular music , fashion and words ) .
The main point is that in assessing the probability of h given e we do not question e ; we assume temporarily that e is certain , and we ignore the chance of e not being true .
Collapsing companies : Try to order from companies that do n't require payment in advance because there 's little chance of getting your money back if the trader goes bust .
When Margaret Hughes arrived at court in Leominster she knew there was a chance she 'd be sent to prison .

I reckon anything over an inch long by November has a good chance of making it .

And I reckon that we 've got a good chance beating Sheffield Wednesday at football .

Steve Whitton has not travelled because of a bruised hip but there is a chance that Simon Milton will come into the reckoning after successful operations on his ankle and knee .
